result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob J Purdy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: Penalty-Fraud/Obtaining Prescriptions], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs on each count of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: Perform 40 hours of uncompensated community service for non-profit agency.

Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jacob J Purdy in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Defendant Jacob J Purdy in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 3. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 3. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
E-mail from Defense advising of inability to contact Defendant. Per Court, warrant.

Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion regarding length of time since last hearing. Defense is unsure where Defendant is, requests until end of day tomorrow to find Defendant, advises that case will resolve. Court will hold off on warrant until 4:30 tomorrow.

Pre-trial conference at 10-08-2015 01:30 pm.
Jury trial at 10-20-2015 08:30 am.
Defendant Jacob J Purdy in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests that case be set for trial and pre-trial (one day).
from Defendant's mother in support of Defendant

Defendant Jacob J Purdy in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense has one outstanding issue to discuss with State. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jacob J Purdy in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense has to go over discovery with Defendant, requests continuance.  Status conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. To be fingerprinted and photographed within 10 days.

Defendant Jacob J Purdy in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense enters not guilty pleas.  Status conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.
